description: We build RC aircraft to learn about the various aspects of programming and aerospace engineering, and are currently developing a plane for a mock search-and-rescue mission.

cards.heading: Team at TJHSST
cards.content: We are a group of innovative high-schoolers from the Thomas Jefferson High School for Science and Technology, currently ranked as the #1 high school in the nation.

cards.heading: Aerospace Geeks
cards.content: In addition to developing and flying unmanned aircraft for fun, we create a search-and-rescue UAV for the annual [AUVSI SUAS competition](https://www.auvsi-suas.org/).

cards.heading: UAV Enthusiasts
cards.content: Design and build.  Program and fly.  Crash and repeat.  We love every part of the process.

about.title: About Us
entries: We are the Thomas Jefferson Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (TJUAV) Team, a group of curious and driven high-school students learning about the development and operation of unmanned aerial systems through experience and discovery.

We participate in the annual AUVSI SUAS competition, where we compete with an Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) against colleges from around the world.  In 2023, TJUAV placed 14rd overall out of over 44 competing mostly-collegiate teams, Visit [https://www.auvsi-suas.org/](https://www.auvsi-suas.org/) for more information.

Working on the airframe, designing electrical systems, engineering a ground vehicle, developing an autopilot system, transmitting data with an aircraft, and autonomously classifying images, we are in a constant positive feedback loop, uncovering new knowledge every day.

sponsor.title: Sponsors
sponsor.description: Since we are a group of high-schoolers, we don't have much to spend on equipment that would aid us in our learning process, such as materials for each member to be able to create their own RC aircraft. Please consider sponsoring us. Review our [sponsorship packet](/sponsorship-packet.pdf) and complete the contact form if you are interested.
